reviewText:
What a phenomenal artist!!! Love this movie, the story is compelling to say the least!!
Check it out!!
A fantastic and complex portrait of an East Village music/composer of both original and funky disco tracks to experimental music. Best Album is World of Echos.
This was an amazing documentary. It shed a lot of light on an otherwise obscure artist. It was well paced, informed, and shot. Give it a watch!

Great film about an amazing musician. I haven't read Tim Lawrence's 'Hold On To Your Dreams' yet, so this was a fascinating first look at Arthur's life--I especially appreciated the interviews with his parents and partner. Overall, this was a great look at a true genius!
this film was made by a very young director, originally as a short documentary; his sensitivity and that of the friends and parents of Arthur is visceral

What an amazing documentary of an amazing musical talent! Arthur Russell was one of the seminal influences in disco and 1970s-1980s avant garde music, yet most people have never heard of him. Matt Wolf's documentary brings Arthur and his music back to life through the eyes of his friends, family, and collaborators - and, of course, through his music.
